title: Thatching
creator_credit: International Film Bureau, E. Lawrence Couter and Angus MacAskill
brief_description: The film details a process important to house-building in England and the early New England colonies. Using authentic tools and techniques, a seasoned worker at the Plimoth Plantation in Massachusetts thatches the roof of a newly constructed cottage. The film covers all steps, which usually takes one man from eight to ten weeks to complete.
